intro: Scleria lingulata, commonly known as the narrowleaf spikerush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetland environments in North America. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and other grass-like plants. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered spikes of pale green to brown flowers. Scleria lingulata typically grows in moist soils, often in marshes or along the edges of ponds and streams. Its structure and growth habits make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
